channel.title: Ibm on DistributedFog

item.title: MQTT
item.description:
MQTT is a publish-subscribe-based lightweight messaging protocol for use on top of TCP/IP. It is designed for connections where a small code footprint is required or the network bandwidth is limited. Wikipedia Research CoAP vs MQTT, MQTT and REST, Push Notifications, Secure MQTT
MQTT-SN is a variation of the main protocol aimed at embedded devices on non-TCP/IP networks, such as ZigBee. As it does not require the TCP/IP stack, it can be used over a serial link where overhead is really small or over UDP.
